titleInfo.title: Gillis Long Oral History Project
titleInfo.subTitle: John B. Breaux oral history interview, 1987

name.description: John Breaux, a Democrat, U.S. representative (1972-1986), and U.S. senator (elected in 1986) from Louisiana, graduated from Louisiana State University Law School in 1967. He met Gillis Long in the late 1960s, when Long was running for governor and Breaux was working for Edwin Edwards. Gillis Long (1923-1985) was representative for the 8th U.S. Congressional District of Louisiana in 1963-1965 and 1973-1985. He ran unsuccessfully for governor of Louisiana in 1964 and 1971.

mods.abstract: Part of a series conducted by Gary Huey, the interview was for a biography on Gillis Long. Breaux discusses Long's professional career (including his running for governor in 1971, his campaigns for Congress, and his service there) and love of politics, as well as his effectiveness at fundraising and involvement in the Democratic Leadership Council.
